cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccines and Multiple Sclerosis |When|| | February 19, 2021 1 p.m. to 2:10 p.m. |Where|| | Virtual event |Contact Information| Join the OHSU MS Center for a webinar on COVID-19 vaccines and MS to discuss how they work, the safety and efficacy of the vaccines currently available, and the recommendations for people living with MS. Attendees will have the opportunity to email questions for the speakers during this live streamed event. Who should attend? People living with MS, caregivers, and others interested in MS are invited to attend. Agenda 1 - 1:40 P.M. COVID-19 Vaccine overview [Marcel Curlin, M.D.](/providers/marcel-e-curlin-md) Associate Professor of Medicine, OHSU Division of Infectious Diseases 1:40 - 2 P.M. MS and COVID vaccination [Vijayshree Yadav, M.D., M.C.R., FAAN ](/providers/vijayshree-yadav-md-mcr-fana-faan) Professor of Neurology and OHSU Multiple Sclerosis Center 2 - 2:10 P.M. Q&A with speakers Registration This virtual program is FREE to attend. A confirmation of registration will be provided with participant details.
